content.question: The figure above shows the graph of the function f. If <math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> </math> and the shaded region has an area of 2, what is the value of g(2)?

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
